title: How to Make Garlic Parmesan Macaroni and Cheese

steps.headline: Boil the dry pasta in salted water for the amount of time on the package.
steps.description: Cook until the pasta is tender and al dente, but do not over-boil.

steps.headline: Drain the pasta in a colander and set aside by pouring it on a baking tray.
Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).
Melt 2 tablespoons of butter with the breadcrumbs and stir until the mixture is golden brown.
Transfer the breadcrumb mixture into a bowl.
Melt the rest of the butter and add the garlic.
steps.description: Saute for about one minute, stirring with a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Pour in the milk, one cup at a time, and reduce the heat to low.
Bring the mixture to a boil until it starts to thicken.
Fold in the corn starch or flour, chicken powder, and salt and pepper.
Fold in the cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, and mozzarella cheese.
steps.description: Mix with a wooden spoon until the sauce is creamy and there are no lumps.

steps.headline: Toss and stir in the cheese sauce into the pasta.
Sprinkle the breadcrumbs mixture over the macaroni.
Bake the macaroni an cheese for about 10-15 minutes, until it's golden brown and it bubbles.
Allow the macaroni and cheese to cool for about 10 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Slice the macaroni and cheese and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy!

text: Boil the dry pasta in salted water for the amount of time on the package. Cook until the pasta is tender and al dente, but do not over-boil. Drain the pasta in a colander and set aside by pouring it on a baking tray.  Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).  Melt 2 tablespoons of butter with the breadcrumbs and stir until the mixture is golden brown.  Transfer the breadcrumb mixture into a bowl.  Melt the rest of the butter and add the garlic. Saute for about one minute, stirring with a wooden spoon. Add the flour and whisk.  Pour in the milk, one cup at a time, and reduce the heat to low. Continue to whisk. Bring the mixture to a boil until it starts to thicken.  Fold in the corn starch or flour, chicken powder, and salt and pepper. Whisk until well-combined. Turn off the heat.  Fold in the cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, and mozzarella cheese. Mix with a wooden spoon until the sauce is creamy and there are no lumps. Toss and stir in the cheese sauce into the pasta. Mix. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs mixture over the macaroni.  Bake the macaroni an cheese for about 10-15 minutes, until it's golden brown and it bubbles.  Allow the macaroni and cheese to cool for about 10 minutes.  Serve. Slice the macaroni and cheese and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy!
